intro: Geissospermum urceolatum, commonly known as the broadleaf milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its compound leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant contains latex, which is a milky substance used in traditional medicine by some indigenous communities. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Geissospermum urceolatum plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
